page.title: 11Binstead
page.content: The land in and around Binstead formed part of{Squire Fleming's estate but most has now been sold as freehold to householders and farmers. Before World War I the houses were mainly built of stone and the village consisted of Arnold Road, Chapel Road and Cemetery Road. The original{bakery}was established in 1871 and the Institute was used as council chambers until the amalgamation with Ryde Council. The{old forge}is now a hairdressing salon and Binstead garage is built on the site of a smallholding. The land of{Binstead Lodge Farm}is now a housing estate and riding stables and an equestrian centre are built on the site of the{old {brickfields.}The population of Binstead is now about 2000 people.
